edu.cs495.engine.gfx.requests

Class OverlayRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cs495.engine.gfx.requests.AbstractRequest
      • edu.cs495.engine.gfx.requests.OverlayRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractRequest>

    public class OverlayRequest
extends AbstractRequest
    This is an AbstractRequest which will encapsulate an Image and where to draw it. This is displayed relative to the screen, not the camera. Thus, an Overlay is a "HUD" element. i.e. screen element. Overlay requests will be rendered ontop of all other requests.
    Version:
    February 2019
    Author:
    Spencer Imbleau

      The y coordinate, relative to the screen, for rendering

    • Constructor Detail

      • OverlayRequest

        public OverlayRequest(Image image,
                      int renderOrder,
                      int x,
                      int y)
        Initializes an overlay image request
        Parameters:
        image - - the image to overlay the screen
        renderOrder - - the order of rendering for this request (note: Only applies when comparing overlay requests, as overlays always render ontop of all game rendering requests by default)
        x - - the X coordinate this is rendered at on the screen
        y - - the Y coordinate this is rendered at on the screen
